Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Name: Scarab
Description: This small well-shaped scarab (head, clypeus, prothorax, elytra and serrated legs) was found on the left wrist of the deceased buried in a modest tomb of Mirgissa/Iken. The reverse is carved with a floral motif and a nefer sign ("beautiful, good, perfect").
